reviews.text: I was not sure about going to this hotel, as the reviews were not so great.
reviews.title: good deal

reviews.text: We really liked the hotel. The hotel is located just next to Rambagh palace which is one of the best hotels in India.I think some people feel that SMS hotel is the servant quaters of Rambagh palace.(actually it was used by the army of the maharaja) But we did not mind , as we could not afford to stay at the Rambagh palace but we could use their garden and restaurant. We felt it was a very good deal. the SMS hotel also has its own garden and a small swimming pool where we found a beautiful peacock. My little son really enjoyed it. As we were a member of taj hotel, we could get upgrade to a suite room. We stayed a standard room on the first night which was also nice. The restaurant was bit quiet. Nobody was there. Maybe this was small negative of the hotel.
reviews.title: SMS Hotel Jaipur

reviews.text: Overall, we will surely go back to the hotel.
reviews.title: A hotel for business, not for pleasure

reviews.text: It is hidden treasure. Excellent property nestled in expansive lawns. One of the quietest hotels that I have stayed in. Rooms are large and pleasant. Bathrroms spacious and clean. The only thing that one misses is the lack of a couple of restaurants. The hotel has only 1 restaurant with somewhat limited choices of food. Absence of tandoori preparations is conspicuous.
reviews.title: Spacious big rooms, homely feel

reviews.text: The hotel is situated quite a way from the action in Jaipur, so for me its not really a tourist hotel. The best thing about it is that it's situated next to the Rambagh Palace and is part of the Taj group, although when I asked if they could get a brink at the Palace, since the SMS doesn't have a bar, I was told it was full. The rooms are large and clean; the staff average. It's probably good if you are in Jaipur on business, but not for a holiday.
reviews.title: Very pleasant and comfortable stay!

reviews.text: Reached Jaipur at 7 30 in the morning and to my delight the staff let me check in as soon as I arrived at the hotel. A buisness hotel run by the Taj Group, nothing really fancy but true value for money. The rooms are spacious and elegant. The staff was super efficient but in true Rajasthan tradition went out of the way to make our stay comfortable to a point of making a "customised breakfast" to filling the swimming pool as my daughters wanted to swim. Peacocks running in the garden, the hotel is well located in the buisness district and very accessible. Would love to go back there.
reviews.title: A Royal Experince....!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at SMS for two nights last year in Oct. The location is nice, right next to Ram Bagh and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Staff was courteous and helpful. Breakfast was decent and the charges were OK too. Overall, a nice place to stay, if u dont want to be in the heart of the PINK city all the time!
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this Taj property for a week. It is just adjoining the palatial rambagh palace hotel. The hotel was once part of the Sawai Mansingh palace property and now is a small hotel, with under 30 rooms. The rooms are big and airy and are well furnished. The hygeine is maintained in the bathrooms, though the absence of tubs is glaring.
reviews.title: Just room comfort !

reviews.text: There is only one restaurant in the hotel and as the menu options are very limited. As the staff mentioned, most pople who stay there have their meals outside in the city and often do not use the restaturant servives. The breakfast buffet too is very limited and not very attractive. Just passable, the buffet fare.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Experience!

reviews.text: So stay just for the room and the location. For food, explore Jaipur. It hasmany options.
reviews.title: Serene is the word
Value for Meney!
reviews.text: the propety is basically for convention and banquet purposes! the suite is larger than life with royal interiors, other rooms are also huge and good. adjoining the rambagh palace, this gives us an oppertunity to visit the garden in the evening and see the rambagh palace! the satff is the retired lot from taj who have served like for 3 decades now! food is not good, but rooms are definately value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used my taj points to stay at the SMS and what a waste it was. Its not so much that is wrong with SMS, its just the fact that it is so ordinary and not alluring in any way. Located close to its more illustrious counterpart, The Rambagh Palace, SMS pales in comparison. Its a lonely, empty convention center as oppossed to anything else. The reception staff was not the most pleasant I have seen, unusual for a taj property. The kitchen closed at 10:30, which was another downer. The rooms are spacious and comfortable but have little to offer in terms of character or refinement that would be expected from a "heritage" property in jaipur. Infact, the chirmi palace, where we stayed later during the trip seemed to have so much more to offer at much lower prices.
reviews.title: Ghostly hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall - two thumbs down for SMS-it is tacky like the abbreviation that it uses as its name.
reviews.title: Overpriced - stay away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is over priced , basic and not worthy of the Taj brand. We booked a double room , but was given twin beds. I complained about this and was told that all rooms in the hotel only had twin beds - so be warned. There was no water in the room , requested some and next morning when we got the bill had been charged. I've never been charged for basic water in any indian hotel. Breakfast is basic but ok (indian 3 star).
reviews.title: Not a recommended hotel!

reviews.text: Fortunately I only used this hotel two nights for transit into and out of jaipur. Very over priced for what you get.
reviews.title: Staff nasty and unpleasant

likes.liked: — Proximity to the Rambagh Hotel, wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: We went to Jaipur in May 2011 with Family and stayed at SMS Hotel, which is a Taj Group Property. It was a best deal we got and the facilities were amazing. We stayed for 3 Nights and 4 days.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.text: Overall it was a nice experience. We'll definitely come back and stay in SMS for sure.
reviews.title: Great service and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friends and I stayed at SMS Jaipur recently, and we were very pleased with the location, facility and especially the staff. Munshi Ram and his co-workers were extremely accommodating when we dined, when we requested help with transportation or suggestions as to what to do in Jaipur, and when we wanted to extend our stay on short notice. The room was very clean and beautiful, the beds were comfortable and the food and service were fantastic!
reviews.title: Great location - but lousy service and facilities

reviews.text: We visited the Rambagh Palace extensively, and unlike previous reviewers, we did not feel like we were treated differently because we were staying at the SMS. We had drinks and appetizers at the Polo Club, took a free ride in the hotel's 1937 Plymouth, and used the services of the on-site travel agent.
reviews.title: Budget but not worth the Taj brand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay at SMS Jaipur, and I will definitely stay there again when I return to Jaipur. Thank you!
reviews.title: Not Worthy of being called a TAJ property
